children.subject: You should schedule an appointment with an advisor.

history.content: It doesn't disqualify from applying. Apply anyways, and talk to an advisor about which grade they will consider for math 1B.

Our policy dictates treating a P grade as C-, but you might be able to submit a petition which will be reviewed by faculty to count your new grade in math 1b instead. Please find the link  to the petition here

So i came into cal as intended cog sci with a cs minor, so I took the 61 series all for a letter grade like the minor required. CS70 was also a requirement so I wanted to improve my mathematical maturity before taking it, and I took math 1a and 1b. These weren't requirement so I took 1b P/NP and received a P. After taking 61c I decided I wanted to be a full on CS major and took 1b again for a letter grade because then it would be a requirement for me. I sent in my app because I'm declaring this semester, but I just read somewhere that taking 1b again disqualifies me from declaring? Even if I wasn't intended CS when I took it the first time? Please someone clarify because I'm freaking out now as I'm a junior and I put all my chances into making this GPA cap.
history.subject: Please clarify this for me (declaration reqs)
